p: It is important to specify that “microgreens” in their commercial definition (see also Section 1) do not include the consumption of radicles, so that they are considered as fresh cut vegetables, and microbiological risks can be managed with the existing technologies and packaging, prior and during commercialization [ 200] (see also Reference [ 201]). It follows that the “Microbiological safety” section refers principally to the freshly consumption of sprouts (including seeds) (see also Reference [ 2]).
